exactmatch.update(pkgdict[command]) TypeError: unhashable type: 'YumHistoryPackageState'
# rpm -q dnf dnf-1.0.1-3.fc23.noarch
Thanks for the report. Can you reproduce it with python2-dnf package and running dnf-2?

There is no python2-dnf package, only python-dnf.
And no, it is not reproducible with dnf-2.
# rpm -q python-dnf python3-dnf dnf python-dnf-1.0.2-3.fc24.noarch python3-dnf-1.0.2-3.fc24.noarch dnf-1.0.2-3.fc24.noarch
*** Bug 1259671 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 1264185 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Seeing this as well on my updated F23 machines: dnf-1.1.4-2.fc23.noarch The machine was upgraded from F22 via dnf system-upgrade (and I think from F21 using fedup).
This is easily reproducible on F23. What questions do the developers have that we (the users) can answer?

> What questions do the developers have that we (the users) can answer?
Well, they had asked a question in comment 1, and I've answered in comment 2.
This error still occurs on in a fresh Fedora 23 VM with dnf 1.1.6-1 and 1.1.6-2 from updates-testing.

Similar problem has been detected:
I was using dnf history search for libinput. After displaying history for one entry, I got a python backtrace.
reporter: libreport-2.6.4 cmdline: /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/dnf history info libinput event_log: 2016-02-11-23:34:53> (Â»report_uReportÂ« erfolgreich abgeschlossen) executable: /usr/bin/dnf kernel: 4.3.5-300.fc23.x86_64 package: dnf-1.1.6-2.fc23 reason: packages.py:76:parsePackages:TypeError: unhashable type: 'YumHistoryPackageState' runlevel: N 5 type: Python3

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase

This bug also occurs on a Fedora 23 with follow command:
% sudo dnf history info kernel Last metadata expiration check performed 0:03:48 ago on Fri Mar 4 12:41:12 2016. I don't know if this helps, but I was stepping through to try and see what data we're dealing with:
Â xenithÂ î‚°Â â‹¯Â î‚±Â site-packagesÂ î‚±Â dnfÂ î‚±Â yumÂ î‚°Â sudo dnf history info pylint Transaction ID : 224 Begin time : Thu Apr 21 13:58:18 2016 Begin rpmdb : 2295:ab73bc398acde3120e11e00a6447374424d48065 End time : 13:58:19 2016 (1 seconds) End rpmdb : 2298:589779b8a7c3623df5746de1a8e1b4dec278bddb User : xenith <xenith> Return-Code : Success Command Line : install pylint Transaction performed with: Installed dnf-1.1.8-1.fc23.noarch @updates Installed rpm-4.13.0-0.rc1.12.fc23.x86_64 (unknown) Packages Altered: > /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages/dnf/yum/packages.py(78)parsePackages() -> exactmatch.update(pkgdict[command]) (Pdb) pkgdict {'pylint.noarch': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], 'pylint-1.4.3': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], 'pylint': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], 'pylint-0:1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], 'pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], '0:pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>], 'pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23': [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>]} (Pdb) pkgdict[command] [<YumHistoryPackageState : pylint-1.4.3-3.fc23.noarch (0x7f928186d6d8)>] (Pdb)
